info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mecklenburg and southeastern Lunenburg Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1109 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Boydton, or 9 miles east of Chase City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... South Hill around 1130 PM EDT. Dundas around 1145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lafoon Corner, Gary, Bacons Fork, Wilburn, Gills Corner, North View, Forksville and Wightman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for south central Virginia.
